titles.title: Maicching Machiko-sensei
Shame of Teacher Machiko
Maicchingu Machiko-sensei
Maitchingu Machiko-sensei
まいっちんぐマチコ先生
Miss Machiko

anime.description: * Based on the manga by http://anidb.net/cr8465 [Ebihara Takeshi]. The series revolves around Miss Machiko, a new elementary school teacher who wears a revealing red mini-skirt and regularly finds herself in accidental sexual situations. Machiko is very popular with her students, especially the boys, who take delight in lifting up her skirts and devising traps to catch her in various stages of undress. Rather than get angry, Machiko responds by laughing it off and uttering her trademark phrase, Maicchingu! (roughly meaning "Embarrassing!"). Machiko is generally a very kind and patient woman who cares about her students and does her best to help them with their problems. Source: Wikipedia

externalentity.identifier: まいっちんぐマチコ先生

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: elementary school
tag.description: The term elementary school is used in some countries for schools where children from the age of about five receive primary education.

tag.name: wrestling
tag.description: Wrestling is a fight between two people without weapons, in which each person tries to beat their opponent. Wrestlers use clinching, holding, locking, and leverage. It resembles ritual fighting as it avoids things that will likely lead to serious injury. It is similar to military hand-to-hand combat or self-defence systems.

tag.name: sumo wrestling
tag.description: Sumo wrestling is a competitive full-contact wrestling sport where a rikishi (wrestler) attempts to force another wrestler out of a circular ring (dohyou) or into touching the ground with anything other than the soles of his feet. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: extrasensory perception
tag.description: Extrasensory perception (ESP), involves reception of information not gained through the recognized physical senses but sensed with the mind. The term was coined by Sir Richard Burton, and adopted by Duke University psychologist J. B. Rhine to denote psychic abilities such as telepathy and clairvoyance, and their trans-temporal operation as precognition or retrocognition. ESP is also sometimes casually referred to as a sixth sense, gut instinct or hunch, which are historical English idioms. The term implies acquisition of information by means external to the basic limiting assumptions of science, such as that organisms can only receive information from the past to the present. In Japanese usage the term is often misappropriated to refer to any supernatural, non-magical, super power. Users of such powers are called `esper` in Japanese. The term `esper` is not normally in use outside of Japan but is slowly being introduced due to its usage in anime and manga. In anime/manga the following powers, among others, are described as ESP: - telepathy - precognition - clairvoyance - retrocognition - remote viewing - aura reading - out-of-body experiences (OBE) - psychokinesis

tag.name: delinquent
tag.description: Delinquents - Every school has them, but not all anime with school setting make delinquents a central topic. There are several versions of these delinquents, though some are grounded on a misunderstanding: * The student with a really bad image and attitude, based on his real criminal actions outside of the school and is even feared by teachers. * The primitive "class bully" that pushes around ("clobbers") his classmates for no apparent reason, possibly extorting lunch money. * The student with an sinister complexion or "evil eye", but is actually a "good" student (unfoundedly feared character). * The rebellious student, who does not care for studying, but is otherwise docile. Called a "delinquent" as a joke.

tag.name: alien
tag.description: This entity or creature was born on another world than the main characters.

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: martial arts
tag.description: Various sports or skills, mainly of Japanese origin, that originated as forms of self-defense or attack, such as judo, karate, and kendo.

tag.name: loli
tag.description: Lolita (often also just abbreviated to loli) refers originally to a novel by Vladimir Nabokov. The book is internationally famous for its controversial subject: the narrator and protagonist, middle aged Humbert Humbert, becomes obsessed and sexually involved with a 12-year-old girl named Dolores Haze. Nowadays the name "Lolita" describes a sexually precocious young girl. Related to this is http://anidb.net/t2415 [lolicon], the Japanese abbreviation of the English phrase "Lolita Complex". Sometimes written as "roricon" or "rorikon" due to the inexact mapping between Japanese and English phonemes. This is the term used to describe the fetish/fascination some mature people have for underage girls. There is an entire industry in Japan devoted to providing legal but schoolgirl-themed pornography, taking advantage of the cute childlike appearance some Japanese women maintain well into their twenties. Because the characters in anime are often young by convention, many fans think that a character can only be Lolicon if she is twelve or younger. Exceptions are granted if the other character in the relationship is a lot older. One particular device used to skirt the boundaries of taste and legality is the exotic being (alien, creature of magic, robot or the like) which takes the form of an underage human girl, but is in fact for all other practical purposes an adult. Another reason why lolicon is fetishized by people may be because some of them just view it as a substitute for their fetish for flat-chested, but otherwise well-developed, women. Source: Wikipedia / TV Tropes

tag.name: ninja
tag.description: A ninja was a covert agent or mercenary of feudal Japan specializing in unorthodox arts of war. The functions of the ninja included espionage, sabotage, infiltration, and assassination, as well as open combat in certain situations. The ninja, using covert methods of waging war, were contrasted with the samurai, who had strict rules about honor and combat.

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: fetishes
tag.description: Everything under fetishes (except for Bishounen and Juujin) is strictly only meant for hentai (18 Restricted) and ecchi anime. In case of ecchi, it must be the main element of the show and not when there`s only some of it, for example, there`s some ecchi in Shinseiki Evangelion, but the fact you get to see Asuka`s pantsu doesn`t warrant it the schoolgirl fetish category. So be careful to which ecchi show you add fetishes; it`s fairly straightforward with hentai, though. Overall, this category tree is to satisfy the needs of people with different fetishes, so they can search for what tingles their tangle; hence why this is restricted to hentai and full ecchi shows.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: super power
tag.description: Be it an ancient Greek Heracles, a cybernetic muscle-man, or a fourteen year-old girl in a mini-skirted sailor suit. As long as they have super powers, they`re in the show.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: nudity
tag.description: Nudity is the state of wearing no clothing. The wearing of clothing is exclusively a human characteristic. The amount of clothing worn depends on functional considerations (such as a need for warmth or protection from the elements) and social considerations. In some situations the minimum amount of clothing (i.e. covering of a person`s genitals) may be socially acceptable, while in others much more clothing is expected. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators. People, as individuals and in groups, have varying attitudes towards their own nudity. Some people are relaxed about appearing less than fully clothed in front of others, while others are uncomfortable or inhibited in that regard. People are nude in a variety of situations, and whether they are prepared to disrobe in front of others depends on the social context in which the issue arises. For example, people need to bathe without clothing, some people also sleep in the nude, some prefer to sunbathe in the nude or at least topless, while others are nude in other situations. Some people adopt naturism as a lifestyle. Though the wearing of clothes is the social norm in most cultures, some cultures, groups and individuals are more relaxed about nudity, though attitudes often depend on context. On the other hand, some people feel uncomfortable in the presence of any nudity, and the presence of a nude person in a public place can give rise to controversy, irrespective of the attitude of the person who is nude. Besides meeting social disapproval, in some places public nudity may constitute a crime of indecent exposure. Many people have strong views on nudity, which to them can involve issues and standards of modesty, decency and morality. Some people have an psychological aversion to nudity, called gymnophobia. Many people regard nudity to be inherently sexual and erotic. Nudity is to be found in a multitude of media, including art, photography, film and on the Internet. It is a factor in adult entertainment of various types. Especially gratuitous fanservice anime shows tend to show their (usually female) characters frequently without any clothes, though often hiding genitals through the means of additions like steam. Source: wiki

tag.name: combat
tag.description: Combat involves a violent conflict with the goal to establish dominance over an opponent.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: wardrobe malfunction
tag.description: A euphemistic term for an embarrassing display of a body part when clothing droops, falls, or is torn. Wikipedia: "Super Bowl XXXVIII half-time show" for more details.

tag.name: skirt flipping
tag.description: Naughty characters — usually boys — flip the skirts of female protagonists to ascertain what panties they are wearing (also see Pantsu category).

tag.name: pantsu
tag.description: "Panties" in Japanese. Upskirt views in various positions are typical, however all forms of partial or fully exposed panties are accepted. Exposure is usually accidental, but may also be deliberate. Pantsu views may be exclusive to the viewer without impacting any characters. Bikinis are not pantsu.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: ecchi
tag.description: Fan service is found in many anime, in many forms. When the service has a distinctly sexual slant to it, and it appears to be a major focus of the show, then it`s safe to assume you`re watching ecchi. The word "ecchi" is used by English-speaking anime fans to refer to refer to soft-core pornographic or sexually suggestive anime and manga. This is a western invention; in Japanese, it is a catch-all term for all things anyhow sexual in nature, not being limited to porn, but also not really considered a "milder" term, as it may also refer to sexual intercourse itself. The term "ecchi" in Japanese comes from the pronunciation of the letter "H" in English, which is rendered into Japanese syllabary as エッチ, which in turn is transliterated in the English alphabet as "ecchi" or "etchi". It is not, as many believe, short for "hentai" -- that, too, seems to be a western invention. It is, however, nearly as misunderstood and misapplied a term as "hentai". The line between ecchi and hentai, from the western perspective over these terms, can be hard to draw at times; one good rule of thumb is: if it was aired on Japanese public TV at all, it probably wasn`t hentai. Ecchi usually features all the specifics to human anatomy that can only be found in anime, and generally avoids full nudity, instead abusing of panty shots. Hentai, on the other hand, will usually show full frontal nudity in some explicit form, including genitalia, and full, intimate sex scenes. At its mildest, ecchi is composed of double entendres, big misunderstandings, and sexual farce; at its most explicit, it is still in the realm of softcore pornography, with full breast shots, full back nudity and similar content, but no display of genitalia. Another good way to distinguish the two is looking for animated sex scenes; if one is found, you have generally left the genre entirely, though a few borderline exceptions apply here. For AniDB`s purposes, the distinction between explicit ecchi and actual hentai is simple: if it was sold with a 18+ restriction in its country of origin, it is hentai; if it was sold without it, it is ecchi. Source: TV Tropes

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: female teacher
tag.description: Any kind of female teacher will do, even if she only does home visits. Female teachers imply mature women (even if they sometimes look like schoolgirls) dressed in what women would typically wear when doing official business (like a blouse, pinstripe dress with side front slit), but of course, not limited to that. Furthermore, school nurses also count as female teachers unless they`re actually wearing a nurse outfit, which they almost never are. Almost completely exclusive to hentai animations.

tag.name: female student
tag.description: Pretty much exclusive to hentai shows only unless an ecchi show has implied sex and/or a strong indicator of nudity. A character is considered a student if she goes to school, doesn`t matter if it`s high school, college or homeschooling, but she should be of appropriate age for a student; a housewife going to college should not get this category.

tag.name: flat chest jokes
tag.description: Jokes about the (supposedly or actually) flat chest of a character.

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: sexual humour
tag.description: Sexual humour is prevalent in this anime. It often involves cheeky or crude sexual language, with innuendos and jokes about the female or male genitalia. Often, such anime also have http://anidb.net/t2856 [ecchi] elements to them.

episode.title: いたずら まいっちんぐ
Pranks? I Give Up!
Itazura: Maicchingu
episode.summary: The mischievous students of Arama Academy meet their match in a beautiful and clever new teacher, Miss Machiko! But they`re determined to find a prank that will really humiliate her... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ケン太のスケボー作戦
Kenta`s Skateboard Plan
Kenta no Skateboard Sakusen
episode.summary: Kenta`s late-night skateboarding lessons have him falling asleep in class. What will Machiko do when she gets her hands on the board? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アイドルにアタック!
Go After the Idol!
Idol ni Attack!
episode.summary: Kame`s over the moon for a popular idol! When Machiko tries to cure him of it, she ends up with an idol debut of her own! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 激突チャリンコ軍団
Clash! The Bicycle Army!
Gekitotsu Charinko Gundan
episode.summary: When a gang from a rival academy starts trouble with Arama`s students, Machiko won`t stand for it! They`ll have to settle their differences... with mud wrestling?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボクも先生にタッチ
I`ll Touch the Teacher, Too
Boku mo Sensei ni Touch
episode.summary: Class bookworm Hiroshi doesn`t like exercise or socializing. Machiko arranges a class outing to cure him of his single-minded nature, but will her plan work too well? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: お手上げべビーギャング
Hands Up! The Baby Gang
Oteage Baby Gang
episode.summary: Machiko tries to help Shizuo, who is staying home to take care of his brothers, a trio of mischievous toddlers. But when they bring them to school, all hell breaks loose! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ギンギン学園祭
The Rockin` School Festival
Gingin Gakuensai
episode.summary: Kinzo is obsessed with bad-boy rock trio Yokohama Ginrrow. Machiko encourages him to follow his dream... by having the whole class mimic the band at the school festival! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 隠しカメラで大勝利
Great Victory with a Hidden Camera
Kakushi Camera de Daishouri
episode.summary: Kenta`s latest obsession is the Frisbee, and everything he can do with it... ripping blouses, flipping skirts, and stealing underwear! Can Machiko learn the skills to put the "Frisbee Angel" in his place? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タッチ魔をやっつけろ
Get the Groper
Touch Ma o Yattsukeru
episode.summary: A groper on a crowded bus is preying on the women and girls of Arama Academy. Kenta takes exception to this cowardly behavior, and vows to catch the culprit! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ズッコケ催眠術
Mixed Up Hypnotism
Zukkoke Saiminjutsu
episode.summary: Mr. Yamagata decides that hypnotism is his only way to win Machiko`s heart. But her fantasy life turns out to be a little different from what he expects... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新兵器ブーブーパンティ
New Weapon: The Whoopee Panties
Shin Heiki Buubuu Panty
episode.summary: The Bicycle Army are back, and this time, they`re framing Kinzo for shoplifting! Can Machiko and Kenta unite to end Genkichi`s bullying once more? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サンタのビックリ・プレゼント
A Surprising Present from Santa
Santa no Bikkuri Present
episode.summary: Machiko`s class decides to help a lonely little girl celebrate Christmas. But the good times are cut short when a thief steals her dog! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋のタイムマシン
The Time Machine of Love
Koi no Time Machine
episode.summary: After getting drunk at a New Year`s party, Kenta dreams he`s taken a time machine to the future... where he`s a handsome adult, and dating Miss Machiko! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: すべってコロンデ大捕り物
The Skating, Falling Roundup
Subette Koronde Ootorimono
episode.summary: An overnight trip to a skating rink becomes a nightmare when the class funds are stolen. And it`s even worse for Yamagata when a handsome stranger begins flirting with Machiko! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボインガードを突破せよ
Break Through the Booby Guard
Boin Guard o Toppa Seyo
episode.summary: The girls decide they`ve had enough of the boys` lecherous ways. But can they keep Kenta from playing pranks on Miss Machiko, even for one day? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: かぐや姫にプロポーズ
A Proposal for Princess Kaguya
Kaguya-hime ni Propose
episode.summary: When a spoiled rich kid offers marriage to Machiko, Mr. Yamagata and Nabe counter with proposals of their own! Can the class help Machiko shake off all three unwanted suitors? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人のマチコ先生
Two Miss Machikos
Futari no Machiko-sensei
episode.summary: A kidnapper mistakes Miss Machiko for a rich heiress, and tries to hold her ransom! But it seems there`s more to him than meets the eye... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: バレンタインの決闘
Valentine`s Duel
Valentine no Kettou
episode.summary: Mr. Yamagata`s insistence that Machiko gave him Valentine`s Day chocolates leads him to clash with another of her unwanted suitors. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦マチコ組対ケン太組
The Match! Team Machiko vs. Team Kenta
Kessen Machiko Gumi tai Kenta Gumi
episode.summary: Kenta and Kame have tried everything in the book to restore confidence to their depressed friend, Kinzo. The only thing left to try is... a wrestling match! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サーカスがやってきた
The Circus Is Here
Circus ga Yattekita
episode.summary: A runaway elephant and an injured trapeze artist lead to Machiko`s entire class taking part in the circus! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マイコン・バースディ
The Microprocessor Birthday
Micom Birthday
episode.summary: The whole school has come together to celebrate Miss Machiko`s birthday. Yamagata is determined to use the occasion to prove that he and Machiko are the perfect couple... and hires a matchmaking robot for the task! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宇宙からのおくりもの
A Present from Space
Uchuu kara no Okurimono
episode.summary: When a UFO descends on the town, Madoka and Yamagata gain psychic powers! Madoka uses hers to defend her friends and fight for justice... while Yamagata uses his to spy on Machiko in the bath! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青い目のライバル
The Blue-Eyed Rival
Aoi Me no Rival
episode.summary: When a beautiful blonde from America refuses Kenta`s advances, Kenta becomes even more determined to get his feelings through... and what better way than a boys-versus-girls sumo tournament? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒップでスイング1[イチ],2[ニー],3[サン]
Swing with the Hips, One, Two, Three
Hip de Swing Ichi, Ni, San
episode.summary: Dr. Aomori has arranged a golf tournament with a new video recorder as the prize. Kenta, Kame, and Kinzo are determined to help Machiko win it by any means necessary! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ねらわれた春休み
Spring Vacation in Peril
Nerawareta Haruyasumi
episode.summary: Miss Machiko takes a brooding Hiroshi along to a girls-only tennis camp to try to cheer him up. Of course, Kenta`s not going to let him be the only boy there... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怪獣ナッシーを探せ
Find the Monster, Nassie
Kaijuu Nassie o Sagase
episode.summary: Reports of an ancient dinosaur in a local lake bring Machiko and her students to investigate! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛のワンタッチラーメン
The One-Touch Ramen of Love
Ai no One Touch Ramen
episode.summary: When a new ramen shop starts offering a trip to Hawaii, Nabe`s business is in trouble! Of course, Kenta has new a plan to round up customers... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 思いちがいで2度タッチ
Two Touches and a Misunderstanding
Omoichigai de Nido Touch
episode.summary: Mr. Yamagata overhears Miss Machiko talking about how she wants to quit school. Will quitting in solidarity lead to her love... or backfire spectacularly? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カラスの勝手でショー
The Crow Does What He Wants
Glass no Katte de Show
episode.summary: A naughty neighborhood crow is stealing Miss Machiko`s panties, and it`s up to her and the boys to get them back! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボインが切り札シーソー合戦
The See-Saw Battle Decided by Boobs
Boin ga Kirifuda Seesaw Kassen
episode.summary: Kenta`s job at a local amusement park is threatened when Genkichi`s dad decides to buy the place and tear it down! Can he cook up a prank smart enough to save the children`s paradise? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: SOS青い珊瑚礁
SOS! The Blue Lagoon
SOS Aoi Sangoshou
episode.summary: A crash landing on a bountiful tropical island should be paradise for Kenta and his class... until they`re interrupted by a tyrannical holdover from the war! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボインにギブアップ
The Boobie Tap Out
Boin ni Give Up
episode.summary: A pro wrestling manager scouts Kinzo for the big leagues... but it all turns out to be a gimmick for a match with a beautiful lady wrestler! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ケン太の突撃レポーター
Kenta the Action Reporter
Kenta no Totsugeki Reporter
episode.summary: Kenta causes trouble all around the school when he decides to play reporter... by breaking news on Machiko`s private life! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 挑戦・美人コンテスト
Take On the Beauty Contest
Chousen Bijin Contest
episode.summary: When Kenta, Kame, and Kinzo break a valuable vase, Miss Machiko decides to take part in a beauty contest to help them pay back their debt! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 先生のヒップは100馬力
Teacher`s Hips Have 100 Horsepower
Sensei no Hip wa 100 Bariki
episode.summary: When a troubled new student comes to the school, Miss Machiko will do anything to help fix his family situation. But will that include dressing as a geisha to turn his father around? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マシュマロ白馬天狗
Marshmallow White Knight Tengu
Marshmallow Hakuba Tengu
episode.summary: Kenta ends up playing a role in a period drama on TV. But a serious injury on set leads to Miss Machiko playing the lead! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 青空田植え教室
The Field Planting Field Trip
Aozora Taue Kyoushitsu
episode.summary: Mr. Yamagata leads a field trip to a farm, where he ends up in a rivalry with a handsome college friend of Miss Machiko. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 赤ん坊がくれた平和
The Peace a Baby Brings
Akanbou ga Kureta Heiwa
episode.summary: A speaker comes to Arama Academy, stirring up dissent between the boys and the girls! Can Miss Machiko get them to work out their differences before tragedy strikes? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 7月7日のランデブー
The July 7th Rendezvous
7-gatsu Nanoka no Rendezvous
episode.summary: On the eve of Tanibata, Kenta tries to help Kameyama confess his love to the girl of his dreams. But when he sees her going out with another man... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イルカの恩返し
The Dolphin Returns
Iruka no Ongaeshi
episode.summary: Machiko`s class takes a field trip to the ocean, and ends up saving a dolphin from a net! But will the locals hunt the dolphin down before they can get it to safety? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いじわる自転車レース
The Mean-Spirited Bicycle Race
Ijiwaru Jitensha Race
episode.summary: The town`s annual bicycle race is thrown into chaos by Genkichi`s grandmother, who is willing to do anything to see that her grandson takes the trophy! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マドカの星の王子様
Madoka`s Prince
Madoka no Hoshi no Ouji-sama
episode.summary: Madoka learns that her college-aged crush is slipping into a life of delinquency, and she heads to the wrong side of the tracks to try to help him. Can Machiko and the others save Madoka before she gets in over her head? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とんでも授業参観日
Parents` Day Run Amok
Tondemo Jugyousankan
episode.summary: When an innocent prank on Parents` Day ends up causing a riot, Hiroshi`s outraged mother threatens to pull him out of school! Can Kenta and the others find a way to get him back... before Miss Machiko quits as well?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ドラキュラ博士の実験室
Dr. Dracula`s Laboratory
Dracula Hakase no Jikenshitsu
episode.summary: Machiko, Kenta, and his friends are spending summer vacation doing good deeds for the elderly. But their courage is put to the test when their next client turns out to be a creepy doctor living in a haunted house! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ぼくらは少年天才団
We`re the Boy Geniuses
Bokura wa Shounen Tenseidan
episode.summary: Kenta, Kinzo, and Kame learn the secret to Mr. Yamagata`s amazing memory... self-hypnosis! But when they try it themselves to improve their test scores, things quickly start spiraling out of control... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 祭ばやしでハッピーダンス
A Happy Dance to Festival Music
Matsuribayashi de Happy Dance
episode.summary: Kenta`s mischief ruins the town`s chance to get a popular singer to help with the anniversary festival! Can Miss Machiko find a way to set things right? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: こちらは命の110番
Call Us to Save Your Life
Kochira wa Inochi no 110 Ban
episode.summary: Miss Machiko, Kenta, and the others are performing on a late-night radio show, when they receive a call from a little girl in need... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大逆転マッチースマッシュ
The Comeback Macchi Smash
Daigyakuten Macchi Smash
episode.summary: To keep Miss Machiko away from a handsome new suitor, Mr. Yamagata cooks up a wild story about aliens. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ばんざい 竹の子族
Banzai, Takenoko Dancers
Banzai Takenoko Zoku
episode.summary: All the cool kids want to join in with the latest craze, the Takenoko Dance! Kenta fosters a rivalry with a cocky young star who turns out to be more than meets the eye... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ケン太の家庭教師
Kenta the Home Tutor
Kenta no Kateikyoushi
episode.summary: Hiroshi is hired to tutor a spoiled rich young man. But when his so-called pupil makes life hell for him, can Kenta step in to make things right? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 2人3脚まっしぐら
The Enthusiastic Three-Legged Race
Futari 3 Kyaku Masshigura
episode.summary: Sports Day has arrived, and Kenta hopes to be paired up with Miss Machiko... but he`s paired up with Maruko instead! Can Kenta find a way out of the arrangement and still win the individual award? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 想い出のヒップライン
The Hip Line of My Memories
Omoide no Hip Line
episode.summary: Mr. Fukuoka is saying goodbye to Arama Academy to return to his home town. But Miss Machiko misunderstands and thinks he`s moving to Paris! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: イースター島からの使者
The Messenger from Easter Island
Easter Tou kara no Shisha
episode.summary: When a Moai statue inexplicably ends up on Arama Academy`s doorstep, the faculty become convinced that only a sacred ritual can send it home. And the only one who can perform it is... Mr. Yamagata?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 赤毛のペチャパイ
The Red-Haired Board
Akage no Pechapai
episode.summary: To cheer the girls up after an awful day of pranking, Miss Machiko tells them a story about her own youth. As it happens, she once knew a mischievous little boy who was a lot like Kenta... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新発見・山形原人
A New Discovery: The Primitive Yamagata
Shinhakken Yamagata Genjin
episode.summary: An archaeological excursion into the mountain behind Arama Academy yields a remarkable discovery: a mural depicting the ancestors of Mr. Yamagata and Miss Machiko! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恋のシャッターチャンス
A Chance for Photographic Love
Koi no Shutter Chance
episode.summary: A new art teacher arrives, triggering Mr. Yamagata`s jealousy. Can he impress Miss Machiko with his photography skills? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カンフーレディNO.1
Kung-Fu Lady Number One
Kung-Fu Lady No. 1
episode.summary: Miss Machiko falls for a handsome kung fu dojo. But Bruce has a dark secret he won`t admit to anyone... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忍者サユリちゃん
Sayuri the Ninja
Ninja Sayuri-chan
episode.summary: The class gets a pretty new exchange student named Sayuri. She`s trying to hide the fact that her family are ninjas, but Kenta`s pranks won`t make it easy! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 南の島からラブコール
The Love Call from the South Seas
Minami no Shima kara Love Call
episode.summary: When the king of an island nation arrives in Arama for a friendship visit, he falls head over heels for Miss Machiko! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラブラブハネムーン
The Lovey-Dovey Honeymoon
Love Love Honeymoon
episode.summary: Mr. Yamagata`s grandmother is visiting... and she thinks he`s engaged to Machiko! Will Machiko keep up the charade to protect her colleague`s dignity? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ケン太のびっくり大予言
Kenta`s Big Shocking Prediction
Kenta no Bikkuri Daijogen
episode.summary: When Kenta plays fortune-teller at a festival, he ends up filling Mr. Yamagata`s head with crazy ideas... including one about an impending alien invasion?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボインで脱出・大ピンチ
The Big Boobie Bail-Out
Boin de Dasshutsu Dai Pinch
episode.summary: What starts as class trip to a voice actor recording studio ends with Miss Machiko voicing the lead in a hot new robot anime! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 健康ジョギング一直線
Healthy Jogging in a Straight Line
Kenkou Jogging Icchokusen
episode.summary: Hiroshi`s health is failing, and he needs exercise! Miss Machiko offers to help, but of course, Mr. Yamagata won`t be left out... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒップで直かっこう
A Straight Ski from the Hips
Hip de Chokkakkou
episode.summary: Machiko and the girls are invited to stay at a ski resort run by Kinzo`s uncle. But a reckless dare treatens to turn their holiday into a tragedy! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キスキスXマス・ケーキ
Kiss Kiss Christmas Cake
Kiss Kiss X`Mas Cake
episode.summary: Maruko is set to play Santa at the school Christmas party, but when the time comes, she never arrives. What`s happened to Maruko, and does it have something to do with the bully Genkichi? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マチコのライオンならし
Machiko the Lion-Tamer
Machiko no Lion Narashi
episode.summary: When a woman abandons her child, Machiko takes the girl in while they search the mother. But when a trip to the zoo goes awry... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あしなが草の秘密
The Secret of Longleg Weed
Ashinaga Kusa no Himitsu
episode.summary: Mr. Yamagata is desperate to try a new plant that is rumored to give people longer legs. But when he finally gets his hands on it, things start to get strange... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: モテモテ美容術
The Secrets of Beauty and Popularity
Motemote Biyoujutsu
episode.summary: Arama Topics is looking for new submissions. While the boys try to do an in-depth article on Miss Machiko, the girls attempt to learn Mr. Kagoshima`s secrets! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボインのふくらし粉
The Boobie Baking Powder
Boin no Fuku Rashi Kona
episode.summary: Kenta and the gang have gone wild about painting the clay models sold by a local vendor. But when the vice principal forbids the hobby, they find a new outlet for their creativity. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝書バト救助隊
The Homing Pigeon Rescue Squad
Denshobato Kyuujotai
episode.summary: Kinzo`s trained homing pigeons end up coming in handy when he gets mixed up in a kidnapping! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 赤オニ青オニ親子オニ
Red Oni, Blue Oni, Family Oni
Aka Oni Ao Oni Oyako Oni
episode.summary: A trip into the mountains for Setsubun (the first day of spring) gets a little out of control when the boys run off ahead, and spot an oni! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: やったぜマンガ先生
Great Job, Manga Artist
Yattaze Manga-sensei
episode.summary: Miss Machiko saves the life of a popular manga artist who`s running desperately low on ideas. Will she and her class be able to pull him out of the dumps? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 仲良しサイホウ教室
The Friendly Needlework Class
Nakayoshi Saihou Kyoushitsu
episode.summary: When Kame learns sewing to help his family with their new cleaning business the other boys tease him relentlessly. Can Machiko find a way to smooth things over? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ジロチョーが行く
The Travels of Jirocho
Jirochou ga Iku
episode.summary: A traveling salesman visits Arama... and he might just put down roots for Machiko! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おひなさまは誰の手に
To Whom Goes the Empress?
Ohina-sama wa Dare no Te ni
episode.summary: A series of strange pranks leads Miss Machiko to encourage the boys and girls to work together on a Girls` Day project. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 強敵ライバル3人組
The Powerful Rival Trio
Kyouteki Rival 3 Nin Gumi
episode.summary: Miss Machiko encourages the boys befriend a lonely elementary schooler. Kenta isn`t interested... until he learns that the boy will pay him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天狗の守り神
The Guardian Tengu
Tengu no Mamorigami
episode.summary: The principal leads a trip to the mountains to catch a legendary fish. But will a supernatural threat keep him from his glory? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ハクション春のカゼ
Achoo! A Spring Cold!
Hakushon Haru no Kaze
episode.summary: Kenta goes to a local shrine to pray for Miss Machiko to recover from a cold, but an encounter with a yukionna gives him much more than he bargained for. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: とんでもケン太の誕生日
Kenta`s Unbelievable Birthday
Tondemo Kenta no Tanjoubi
episode.summary: Maruko`s ambiguously-labeled birthday gift to Kenta kicks off a chain of misunderstandings. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ボインでパトロール
The Boobie Patrol
Boin de Patrol
episode.summary: Miss Machiko takes on the duties of policewoman for a day. But her usually no-nonsense partner`s mind is focused on more romantic troubles... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 教頭先生の大決断
The Vice Principal`s Big Decision
Kyoutousensei no Dai Ketsudan
episode.summary: Fed up with the behavior of Arama`s students, Vice Principal Aichi considers a lucrative offer from a fancier school. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不思議なスーパードレス
The Mysterious Super Dress
Fushigi na Super Dress
episode.summary: Miss Machiko gets scouted by a world-class fashion designer. Fearing that she might leave for good, Kenta decides to prank the fashion show. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マジック人形劇
The Magic Puppet Show
Magic Ningyougeki
episode.summary: Can children be satisfied with old-fashioned entertainment? Machiko hopes so, when she agrees to help a humble puppeteer put on his show. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 5月5日の特攻作戦
The May 5th Ambush
5-gatsu Itsuka no Tokkou Sakusen
episode.summary: It`s Children`s Day, and Kenta urges Machiko to create some koinobori banners. Of course, his secret motive is to climb inside one and spy on the bath! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スカート禁止命令
The Skirt Prohibition
Skirt Kinshi Meirei
episode.summary: Annoyed at Kenta`s constant harassment of the girls, the vice principal decides to nip things in the bud... by banning skirts from school. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 超能力のプレゼント
The Psychic Present
Chounouryoku no Present
episode.summary: An encounter with a master prognosticator leads Miss Machiko to have disastrous visions of the future. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛のトンチンかんちがい
The Terrible Love Misconception
Ai no Tonchin Kanchigai
episode.summary: Miss Machiko is looking forlorn, and the students assume she`s fallen in love. But as they follow her around for the day, they realize the truth is far bleaker. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ワンダーランド大追跡
The Great Pursuit Through Wonderland
Wonderland Daitsuiseki
episode.summary: A class visit to a science expo turns into a mad chase when a con man steals the students` bags... and their clothes! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: タッチでアローハ
Aloha With a Touch
Touch de Aloha
episode.summary: Miss Machiko and the boys visit a school in Hawaii. Can Kenta and the others survive a turning of the tables by the brash Hawaiian girls?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: へとへと人力大飛行
The Exhausting Man-Powered Flight
Hetoheto Jinriki Dai Hikou
episode.summary: The boys build a variety of pedal-powered flying machines, one of which takes Machiko and Kenta on a death-defying journey. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 里帰り困っちんぐ
The Troubling Trip Home
Satogaeri Komacchingu
episode.summary: On hearing that her father`s been in an accident, Machiko rushes home to Kyoto. But it all turns out to be a trick to get her engaged to a local man! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: パリ発 いとしのマチコ
Beloved Machiko Goes to Paris
Paris Hatsu Itoshi no Machiko
episode.summary: A "Cinderella Story" search breaks out when Machiko proves the only perfect fit for a famous Parisian designer`s bra. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラジコン大飛行
The Great Remote Control Flight
Radicon Dai Hikou
episode.summary: When Kenta and friends accidentally take out the local ramen delivery boy with their remote-control planes, Machiko decides to take over his duties. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 羽衣をなくした天女
The Angel Who Lost Her Robe
Hagoromo o Nakushita Tennyo
episode.summary: The girls spearhead a trip to Maruko`s relatives in the country, where a local legend says the tea can make girls bustier. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛のソフトタッチ
The Soft Touch of Love
Ai no Soft Touch
episode.summary: Arama Academy`s 80th anniversary celebration is threatened when the vice principal`s hard-nosed niece transfers to the school. Source: crunchyroll
